info.name: WaDE OGC API
info.description:
This API service, available by the Western States Water Councilâ€™s (WSWC)  
Water Data Exchange (WaDE) Program, conforms to the Open Geospatial  
Consortium (OGC) API features and environmental data retrieval  
specifications. WaDE is committed to publicly sharing water rights,  
supply, use, and regulatory overlay data through a streamlined and  
standardized service that enables regional analyses to inform water  
resources management, planning and policies.

query.description:
Only features that have a geometry that intersects the bounding box are selected.

The bounding box is provided as four numbers.


* Lower left corner, coordinate axis 1

* Lower left corner, coordinate axis 2

* Upper right corner, coordinate axis 1

* Upper right corner, coordinate axis 2

The optional limit parameter limits the number of items that are presented in the response document.

Only items are counted that are on the first level of the collection in the response document. Nested objects contained within the explicitly requested items shall not be counted.

Minimum = 1. Maximum = 1000. Default = 1000.

Default value : 1000
The optional next parameter is used to request the next page of items in a paginated response. The value of the next parameter is the URL to the next page of items.
Comma separated list of Site Uuids
Comma separated list of Overlay Uuids
Comma separated list of Allocation Uuids
Comma separated list of Site Types
Comma separated list of state abbreviations
Comma separated list of water source types

Only data that has a geometry that intersects the area defined by the polygon are selected.

The polygon is defined using a Well Known Text string following

coords=POLYGON((x y,x1 y1,x2 y2,...,xn yn x y)).
The optional next parameter is used to request the next page of items in a paginated response. The value of the next parameter is the URL to the next page of items.
Comma separated list of site Uuids
Comma separated list of overlay Uuids
Comma separated list of allocation Uuids
Comma separated list of site types
Comma separated list of state abbreviations
Comma separated list of water source types

The optional limit parameter limits the number of items that are presented in the response document.

Only items are counted that are on the first level of the collection in the response document. Nested objects contained within the explicitly requested items shall not be counted.

Minimum = 1. Maximum = 1000. Default = 1000.

Default value : 1000

Only features that have a geometry that intersects the bounding box are selected. The bounding box is provided as four or six numbers, depending on whether the coordinate reference system includes a vertical axis (height or depth):

Lower left corner, coordinate axis 1
Lower left corner, coordinate axis 2
Upper right corner, coordinate axis 1
Upper right corner, coordinate axis 2
The optional next parameter is used to request the next page of items in a paginated response. The value of the next parameter is the URL to the next page of items.

Either a date-time or an interval. Date and time expressions adhere to RFC 3339. Intervals may be bounded or half-bounded (double-dots at start or end).

Examples:

    A date-time: "2018-02-12T23:20:50Z"
    A bounded interval: "2018-02-12T00:00:00Z/2018-03-18T12:31:12Z"
    Half-bounded intervals: "2018-02-12T00:00:00Z/.." or "../2018-03-18T12:31:12Z"

Only features that have a temporal property that intersects the value of datetime are selected.
Comma separated list of allocation Uuids
Comma separated list of site Uuids
Comma separated list of state abbreviations
Comma separated list of water source types
Comma separated list of beneficial uses
Comma separated list of owner classification types

Only data that has a geometry that intersects the area defined by the polygon are selected.

The polygon is defined using a Well Known Text string following

coords=POLYGON((x y,x1 y1,x2 y2,...,xn yn x y)).

The optional limit parameter limits the number of items that are presented in the response document.

Only items are counted that are on the first level of the collection in the response document. Nested objects contained within the explicitly requested items shall not be counted.

Minimum = 1. Maximum = 1000. Default = 1000.

Default value : 1000
The optional next parameter is used to request the next page of items in a paginated response. The value of the next parameter is the URL to the next page of items.
Comma separated list of allocation Uuids
Comma separated list of site Uuids
Comma separated list of state abbreviations
Comma separated list of water source types
Comma separated list of beneficial uses
Comma separated list of owner classification types

The optional limit parameter limits the number of items that are presented in the response document.

Only items are counted that are on the first level of the collection in the response document. Nested objects contained within the explicitly requested items shall not be counted.

Minimum = 1. Maximum = 1000. Default = 1000.

Default value : 1000

Only features that have a geometry that intersects the bounding box are selected. The bounding box is provided as four or six numbers, depending on whether the coordinate reference system includes a vertical axis (height or depth):

    Lower left corner, coordinate axis 1
    Lower left corner, coordinate axis 2
    Minimum value, coordinate axis 3 (optional)
    Upper right corner, coordinate axis 1
    Upper right corner, coordinate axis 2
The optional next parameter is used to request the next page of items in a paginated response. The value of the next parameter is the URL to the next page of items.
Comma separated list of site Uuids
Comma separated list of overlay Uuids
Comma separated list of state abbreviations
Comma separated list of overlay types

Default value : 1000
